intro: Streptocarpus × kewensis, commonly known as the hybrid African violet, is a hybrid plant resulting from crosses between Streptocarpus species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically come in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Africa. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Streptocarpus × kewensis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
